{{also|wasser|wässer|Wässer|Wåsser|wàsser}} ==Alemannic German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|gsw|Wâsser|Wàser||Alsatian}} * {{alter|gsw|Wâser||Dunzenheim}} * {{alter|gsw|wasser|wàsser||Italian Walser}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gsw|gmh|wazzer|waʒʒer}}, from {{inh|gsw|goh|wazzar|waʒʒar}}, from {{inh|gsw|gem-pro|*watōr}}, ultimately from {{inh|gsw|ine-pro|*wódr̥}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|Wasser}}, {{cog|nl|-}} and {{cog|en|water}}, {{cog|is|vatn}}. ===Noun=== {{head|gsw|noun|g=n}} # {{lb|gsw|Basel|Alsatian}} [[water]] ====Derived terms==== * {{l|gsw|Wassermoli}} ===References=== * ''Wörterbuch der elsässischen Mundarten'' * Rudolf Suter, ''Baseldeutsch-Grammatik'' (1976): s Wasser {{topics|gsw|Water}} ---- ==Central Franconian== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Waßer}} {{qualifier|native in most dialects; now archaic in many}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmw-cfr|goh|wazzar}}. The use of ''-a-'' instead of the expected ''-ā-'' is influenced by standard {{der|gmw-cfr|de|-}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gmw-cfr|/ˈʋasʌ/}} ===Noun=== {{head|gmw-cfr|noun|g=n|plural|Wasser|diminutive|Wässerche}} # {{lb|gmw-cfr|many dialects}} [[water]] #: {{ux|gmw-cfr|Dat '''Wasser''' vun Kölle es jot.|The '''water''' of Cologne is good. {{qualifier|Line from a [[w:Bläck Fööss|Bläck Fööss]] song.}}}} ---- ==German== {{wikipedia|lang=de}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|wazzer}}, from {{inh|de|goh|wazzar}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*watōr}}, ultimately from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*wódr̥}}. Compare {{cog|nds|Water}}, Dutch and English {{m|en|water}}, Danish {{m|da|vand}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈva.sɐ/}} * {{audio|de|De-Wasser.ogg}} * {{a|Bavaria}} {{audio|de|BY-Wasser.ogg}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n||Wasser|pl2=Wässer|Wässerchen|dim2=Wässerlein}} # [[water]] {{gloss|H₂O}} # alcoholic beverage, similar to [[brandy]], made from fermented fruit ====Usage notes==== * Both plural forms are infrequent. Unchanged '''''Wasser''''' is used as a purely emphatic plural: ''die '''Wasser''' des Rheins'' – the '''waters''' of the Rhine. '''''Wässer''''' is used as an actual plural meaning different kinds of water (or brandy): ''teure und preiswerte '''Wässer''''' – expensive and inexpensive [table] '''waters'''. However, ''Wässer'' is also used emphatically in some compound words such as {{m|de|Abwässer|Ab'''wässer'''|waste water}} and {{m|de|Schmutzwässer|Schmutz'''wässer'''|dirty water}}. ====Declension==== '''Plural ''Wasser''''' {{de-decl-noun-n|s}} '''Plural ''Wässer''''' {{de-decl-noun-n|s|pl=Wässer}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |{{l|de|Abwasser||wastewater; sewage}} |{{l|de|Altwasser||oxbow lake}} |{{l|de|Blut ist dicker als Wasser||blood is thicker than water}} |{{l|de|das Wasser reichen können||to hold a candle|lit=to hand the water}} |{{l|de|Gewässer||body of water, waterbody, water}} |{{l|de|Hochwasser||flood, flooding}} |{{l|de|Kirschwasser||kirsch, a clear brandy made from black cherries}} |{{l|de|Meerwasser||seawater}} |{{l|de|Mineralwasser||mineral water, carbonated water}} |{{l|de|auch nur mit Wasser kochen||}} |{{l|de|Salzwasser||salt water}} |{{l|de|Sprudelwasser||fizzy water}} |{{l|de|Süßwasser||freshwater}} |{{l|de|Trinkwasser||drinking water}} |{{l|de|Wasser predigen und Wein trinken||to not practice what one preaches|lit=to preach water and drink wine}} |Wasserbecken |Wasserbehälter |{{l|de|Wasserbombe||depth charge; water bomb, water balloon|lit=water bomb}} |{{l|de|Wasserdampf||steam; water vapour}} |{{l|de|Wassereis||ice pop, popsicle, ice lolly; frozen water|lit=water ice}} |Wassergewebe |Wassergüte |{{l|de|Wasserfall||waterfall}} |{{l|de|Wasserfarbe||watercolour}} |Wasserfloh |{{l|de|Wasserhund||water dog}} |Wasserkopf |Wasserlauf |{{l|de|Wassermann||Aquarius, Aquarian}} |{{l|de|Wassermühle||water mill}} |{{l|de|wässern||to water}} |{{l|de|Wasserpfeife||water pipe}} |{{l|de|Wasserralle||water rail}} |{{l|de|Wassersäule||water column|g=f}} |{{l|de|Wasserscheide||watershed}} |{{l|de|Wasserski||water skiing; water ski}} |{{l|de|Wasserskorpion||water scorpion}} |{{l|de|Wasserspeier||gargoyle, waterspout}} |{{l|de|Wasserspinne||water spider, diving bell spider}} |Wasserstraße |{{l|de|Wasserstoff||hydrogen}} |Wassertemperatur |Wassertiefe |Wasserverbrauch |Wasserverlust |{{l|de|Wasserwanze||water bug}} |{{l|de|[[wässerig]], [[wässrig]]||watery}} |Weihwasser |{{l|de|Wildwasser||white water}} |{{l|de|Wurstwasser||water in which sausages have been cooked and/or packaged}} }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} {{topics|de|Beverages|Water}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|hrx|waser}} {{q|Wiesemann spelling system}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|hrx|gmh|wazzer}}, from {{der|hrx|goh|wazzar}}, from {{der|hrx|gmw||*watar}}, from {{der|hrx|gem-pro|*watōr}}, from {{der|hrx|ine-pro|*wédōr}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/ˈvasɐ/}} ===Noun=== {{head|hrx|noun|g=n|plural|Wassre}} # [[water]] #: {{ux|hrx|Ich drinke en Glaas '''Wasser'''.|I am drinking a glass of '''water'''.}} ===Further reading=== * [http://www.hunsrik.org/Lexi/SearchResult?searchStr=Brod Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pdc|gmh|wazzer}}, from {{inh|pdc|goh|wazzar}}, from {{inh|pdc|gem-pro|*watōr}}, from {{inh|pdc|ine-pro|*wódr̥}}.
